channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [DERBY-1334] Hang in derbynet/testProtocol.java due to 'access denied (java.io.FilePermission /..../derbyall/derbyall/derbynetmats/DerbyNet/derbynetmats/testProtocol/Server1.trace write)'

item.summary: Hang in derbynet/testProtocol.java due to 'access denied (java.io.FilePermission /..../derbyall/derbyall/derbynetmats/DerbyNet/derbynetmats/testProtocol/Server1.trace write)'

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
This is a result of my patch for DERBY-892.
I didn't notice the hang with derbyall in my windows env, and the test didn't show up as failed...but rechecking on linux I saw this.

The solution is to add a testProtocol.policy file with the required permission. I will do so this afternoon (and test on both platforms to be sure).

I attached a patch - DERBY-1334_20060520.diff - which adds testProtocol.policy.

I reverified the hang in this test before this fix on a Solaris box, and verified the problem doesn't occur with this fix.

Committed to trunk with revision 408077.

Should this be marked regression? Or assigned to regression test failure component?
Actually, it is marked test regression component. so, removing the 'regression' check.
